sentences.english: Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others.
sentences.chinese: 避免说反话或别人的八卦。

sentences.english: Irony is a common pragmatic phenomenon in verbal communication.
sentences.chinese: 反讽即说反话，是言语交际中一种常见的语用现象。

sentences.english: However, I prefer irony this topic.
sentences.chinese: 不过，我还是比较偏爱《反话》这个题目。

sentences.english: He said "well done" with irony, expressing his dissatisfaction about their work.
sentences.chinese: 他说“干得好”是反话，表示对他们工作的不满。

sentences.english: Drop the sarcasm. You know only my mom would love it.
sentences.chinese: 别说反话，你也知道只有我妈才会喜欢它。

sentences.english: Heavy-foot made a derisory noise, proving that he didn't recognize irony when he heard it.
sentences.chinese: 大脚发出了嘲弄的笑声，证明他根本不懂得反话。
希望大自然的力量甚于反话。

sentences.english: It's sometimes not very nice to be sarcastic to a person.
sentences.chinese: 对人讲反话有时候显得很不礼貌。
